p: There are 18 known types of hemagglutinin (H1–H18) and 11 identified serotypes of neuraminidase (N1–N11). Therefore, in theory, 198 diverse combinations of these proteins (and thus subtypes of the influenza A virus) are possible (Skehel 2009; Tong et al. 2013; Quan et al. 2016; Kosik and Yewdell 2019; Zhao et al. 2019); of them, >120 combinations have been identified in nature (Tsai and Chen, 2011; Rejmanek et al. 2015).
